memberdef.type: vector< tuple< unsigned long, Cell, double > >
memberdef.name: distances

briefdescription.para: Sets the is_sequential flag.

parameterdescription.para: if true, dispersal events are selected using the end point of the last dispersal distance for the start of the next move event

briefdescription.para: Sets the pointer to the simulation parameters object.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the simulation parameters to use
if true, writes the parameters out using writeInfo()

briefdescription.para: Import the maps from the simulation parameters.
Creates the map of steps to parameter references and initialises object sizes.
Sets the dispersal parameters in the DispersalCoordinator.
Sets the seed for the random number generator.

parameterdescription.para: the seed

briefdescription.para: Sets the output database for writing results to.

parameterdescription.para: path to the output database

briefdescription.para: Sets the number of repeats to run the dispersal kernel for.

parameterdescription.para: the number of repeats

briefdescription.para: Sets the number of steps to run each repeat of the dispersal kernel for when recording mean distance travelled.

parameterdescription.para: a vector containing each step variable to record the distance at

briefdescription.para: Sets the number of threads launched to parallelise the distance simulation.

parameterdescription.para: the number of workers

briefdescription.para: Gets the maximum number of steps that is to be applied.
Calculates the list of cells to choose randomly from.
Gets a random cell from the list of cells.

simplesect.para: a Cell object reference containing the x and y positions to choose from

briefdescription.para: Checks the density a given distance from the start point, calling the relevant landscape function.

detaileddescription.para: This also takes into account the rejection sampling of density based on the maximal density value from the map.

parameterdescription.para: Cell containing the x and y coordinates of the starting position

briefdescription.para: Checks the density a given distance from the start point, calling the relevant landscape function.

detaileddescription.para: This also takes into account the rejection sampling of density based on the maximal density value from the map.

parameterdescription.para: Cell containing the x and y coordinates of the starting position
Reference to the dispersal coordinator to use

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned long bidx, const unsigned long eidx, const unsigned long num_repeats, std::mutex &mutex, unsigned long &finished, DispersalCoordinator &dispersal_coordinator, double &generation)
memberdef.name: runDistanceLoop

briefdescription.para: Runs the distance simulation edix-bidx times and reports the progress.

parameterdescription.para: If true random walks will be chosen randomly from the cells vector, otherwise uses cells[bidx:edix]
First inclusive index into the cells vector of random walk origins to simulate in this worker
Last exclusive index into the cells vector of random walk origins to simulate in this worker
The number of repeats to average over for each cell
The mutex to synchronise progress feedback to the user
The total number of cells simulated across all workers
Reference to the dispersal corrdinator to use
Reference to the generation variable used byt the dispersal coordinator

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned long seed, const unsigned long bidx, const unsigned long eidx, const unsigned long num_repeats, std::mutex &mutex, unsigned long &finished)
memberdef.name: runDistanceWorker

briefdescription.para: Runs the distance simulation eidx-bidx times on a separate worker and reports the progress.

parameterdescription.para: If true random walks will be chosen randomly from the cells vector, otherwise uses cells[bidx:edix]
Seed to use to initialse the per worker rng and dispersal coordinator
First inclusive index into the cells vector of random walk origins to simulate in this worker
Last exclusive index into the cells vector of random walk origins to simulate in this worker
The number of repeats to average over for each cell
The mutex to synchronise progress feedback to the user
The total number of cells simulated across all workers

briefdescription.para: Simulates the dispersal kernel for the set parameters, storing the mean dispersal distance.
Simulates the dispersal kernel for the set parameters, storing the mean distance travelled.
Simulates the dispersal kernel for the set parameters on all habitable cells, storing the mean distance travelled.
Simulates the dispersal kernel for the set parameters on the given sample cells, storing the mean distance travelled.

parameterdescription.para: Vector of cells to be sampled during the distance simulation

briefdescription.para: Writes the information about this repeat to the logger.
Writes out the distances to the SQL database.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the table to output to, either 'DISPERSAL_DISTANCE' or 'DISTANCES_TRAVELLED'

briefdescription.para: Writes the simulation parameters to the output SQL database.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the table to output to, either 'DISPERSAL_DISTANCE' or 'DISTANCES_TRAVELLED'

briefdescription.para: Clears the parameters from the internal objects so that another dispersal simulation can be run, if necessary.
Gets the maximum parameter reference from the output SQL database and saves val + 1 to parameter_reference Assumes that the database exists.
Gets the maximum id number from the output SQL database and returns val + 1 Assumes that the database exists.

simplesect.para: this function does not check for SQL injection attacks and should not be used with variable function names.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the table to check for max(id) in

simplesect.para: the maximum id + 1 from the given table

briefdescription.para: Contains routines for importing a density map file, running a dispersal kernel n times on a landscape and record the dispersal distances.

node.label: std::vector< tuple< unsigned long, necsim::Cell, double > >
